abstracts.cdata!:
In October 2003, the Government of
            Armenia and the World Bank funded a television program
            called my right to provide Armenian society with information
            on legal rights. To change public opinion and create legal
            literacy, the Bank funded the show through its judicial
            reform project development credit. It worked closely with
            the ministry of justice to identify public information gaps.
            Episodes covered rental and property disputes, torts,
            contract issues, and family law matters: all issues that are
            timely and of broad interest. It generated an immense
            interest in legal issues and citizens' rights among
            viewers, including parliamentarians and lawyers.
